class_notes: Prerequisite: EPI 530 or 504 (may be concurrent) OR instructor permission. Previous coursework in microbiology strongly preferred.  Cross-listed with EPI 562.
course_description: Prerequisite/concurrent: EPI 504, or EPI 530 or permission of instructor. This course examines factors that contribute to the emergence and re-emergence of infectious diseases, and provides a framework for assessing the public health threat changes in these factors on infectious disease epidemiology. Fundamental principles of infectious disease pathogenesis, epidemiology as well as prevention will be addressed using key syndromes or pathogens as examples. Previous course work in microbiology strongly preferred. Cross- listed with EPI 562.
schedule_location: M 1pm-2:50pm in R. Randall Rollins Bldg. R200
sections: Class Nbr: This section is full 2850, Section #: 1, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: M 1-2:50p, Instructor: Team, Status: Closed
